text: Pours in golden amber colour with off white head. Light aroma of hops, grass. Light bitter, medium sweet, gentle bitter alcoholic aftertaste. Medium body, medium carbonization.

*Old rating, best before 10.10.11.  Malzig-würziges Bier. Leicht süßlich und sehr süffig. Schöne Malzkomponenten, die den Alkohol verstecken. Eine passende leichte Herbe kommt hinzu, die mit dem Malz und der Süße gut harmoniert, Ein Hauch Alkohol ist zu schmecken. Lecker.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, würzig, grasig, leicht alkoholisch. Geschmack sehr malzig, würzig, leicht süß alkoholisch.

Ein gar nicht mal so schlechter Bock, der locker von der Hand. Malz dominiert mit einigen Nussaromen und ehe man sich versieht, hat man eine Flasche vernichtet, da der Alkohol hier nur in Nuancen zu schmecken ist. Gefaehrlich dazu, da man sich waehnt, man wuerde nur ein simples Dunkel trinken. Hat durchaus Aehnlichkeiten mit einem Weltenburger Barock Dunkel. Gut, einfach gut.

Six-pack. Clear light brown colour with steady head and medium to smooth body. Nose of strong malt. Taste of dark grains, strong alcohol, dark nuts, brown bread, cloves and light roast. Nice and easy to drink, quite quaffable but you must like malty beers to enjoy this one.
Nice aroma and flavor. Slight banana flavor. Solid heller bock. Would buy another one.

Bottle by 09.09.12.  Nose is sweet and grainy, light bread crust and toffee.  Dulled orange body with a blink-and-you-miss it head.  Crisp medium body is metallic with some booze showing, low bitterness and not too sweet.  Warms the throat slightly, feeds the bacteria around the teeth, has some honey and earth.

Getreidiger Beginn, dezente Malznoten, untertönige Süße. Deutlich intensiver im Mittelteil, hier vereinen sich Malz und Getreidigkeit zu einer führenden Würze. So bleibt das Bier einige Zeit, rund, harmonisch, zum Ende steigt die Bitterkeit geringfügig. Gut! 8/12/11/12/12/12

Bottle 50cl from Quack-Duck, a clear amber brown beer with small creamy head. Nose is malty and caramel like. Aroma is malty, caramel, sweet, a bit grassy and vegetable like, good body, toasted notes, very pleasant.
Yet another gift from the Mayor of Germany - thank you! Soft, light caramel in the sip - very easy to drink. This is a great Mai-Bock!!!

Bottle 500ml. @ home on the terrace.Clear medium amber orange colour with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, hay, straw, caramel, toasted, sugar, malty. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration, malty. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110816]

(bottle) Clear, deep golden to amber colour with a tanned thick foamy head. Moderately sweet cara-malty aroma with bready accents. Sweet and slightly bitter flavour, medium bodied with a moderate carbonation. Bready malt-character with caramel, herbal and subtle fruity notes; sweet-bitter cara-malty finish with present herbal hops and a well-covered alcoholic strength. Good. 09.VII.11

Bottle: Solid caramelly-bready nose with a toasty touch and a tinge of metal; moderate to solid sweet-bitter flavour, quite full bodied; a tinge of alcohol in the sweet-caramelly finish, followed by a light tartness. O.K. , but not great.......

Lovely color, amber/brown, with ample carbonation and a dense initial head. Prototypical maibock aroma, earthy with molasses and leafy hops, slightly spicy - very fresh and very good. Flavor is so German, so natural, so earthy. Slight-to-moderate bitterness (leafy, organic, bitter greens) with some saltiness. Medium sweetness (molasses, iron). Palate almost to spritzy, but not quite. Defines Maibock to me.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Bottle from Quack-Duck, thanks! Pale amber color. Malty bready flavor, firmly hopped. Notes of grass and citrus. peach. Shy aroma with malt and grass. Almost vinous aftertaste. Nice!

500 ml bottle in Germany from my local Norma. Poured a dark amber color with a larger sized tan head. Aroma and taste of yeast, bread, caramel, and light fruits. Very easy to drink. Alcohol content hidden. This was a huge surprise.

Tried to get this beer in Saxony without succes, finally found it in a Norma-market in Mecklenburg-Vorpommern. The bottle looks really good, beer in the glass also, deep golden, nice head. Spicy-grasy aroma. Starts intense spicy, some wheaty-grasy notes, soft touch of lemon. Finish well balanced, not as intense spicy as the beginning, very drinkable. Really good maibock!

bottle from my local Norma supermarket. Accoding to what kappldav123 found out at the brewery, this Maibock is brewed to a different recipe than their regular Maibock. So this is not Einsiedler Maibock. It pours a clear, deep, deep golden colour with a orange glow, mid-sized off-white head. Aroma of caramel. Very full-bodied, intensive malty base with some lemony hops, hints of citrus fruit, as well as caramel and a touch of alcohol. Smooth carbonation, dangerously drinkable!
